answers.author: [Unknown]
answers.text:
Hey Michael,   
I was poking around the  revenue   topic page, and I came across an article about Huntington Beach, CA's revenue-generating, community-enabling project. You can read about their success  here: http://icma.org/en/Article/102438/Huntington_Beach_CA_Becomes_First_City_to_Approve_Revenue_Generating_WiFi_Partnership_Program 
I hope that this helps, and gives you something to consider.      
Best,   
James    
Knowledge Network Intern   
ICMA

answers.author: Mark Abeles-Allison
answers.text:
In Wisconsin we have an optional .5% sales tax.  This is added to the state's 5%.  Most but all counties have instituted this.  Other revenue sources in Wisconsin include a wheel tax (flexible)  $10 to I think $20 per vehicle annually added to registration.

author: Michael Van Milligen
text: The 10 largest cities in the State of Iowa have formed the Metropolitan Coalition. We are considering proposing legislation that would give cities in Iowa access to more revenue sources. Is anyone aware of a study that would show what revenues other states have allowed for cities?
title: Alternative Revenues
